instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Intermittent green light.
threads.message:
Possible liquid damage but has been ultrasonically cleaned before i took a look at it. 

works normally when running on the battery
when the green light finally does come on it charges completely fine and operates normally. 
when battery is connected. battery has to be removed and let sit before plugging power adapter in and actually getting green light. 
here are some measurements
when green light is on 16.9v at pin 1 + 2 j6900

when no green light 1.6v and dropping until it powers back on at pin 1+2 j6900

38.6k to ground from pin 1 j6900

no beep on <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR>
no beep on <CAPACITOR>C7085</CAPACITOR>
no beep on <CAPACITOR>C7087</CAPACITOR>

f6905 0
<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> 468k
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20.3
****<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> 54k not 100k
<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> 62.6k
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> 0
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 10
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 10
<RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR> 0
****<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> 207.4k not 332k
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20.2
<RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> 9.28k
<RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> 29.83k
<RESISTOR>R7042</RESISTOR> 0
<RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR> 4.7
<RESISTOR>R7013</RESISTOR> not present
<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> 1k
<RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR> 100k
<RESISTOR>R7016</RESISTOR> 3k
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> 0
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> 2.3
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> 0
<RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> 0
l7030 0
<RESISTOR>R7040</RESISTOR> 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Intermittent green light.
threads.message:
When the green light disappears, will shorting pins 10 & 11 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> bring <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.23 or no? I have a feeling there's some issue with <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>. 

1.7v is usually the magic number when there's a short circuit to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Intermittent green light.
threads.message: I will check in the morning. Should I worry about the resistors that are measuring under spec also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Intermittent green light.
threads.message:
Shorting pins 10&11 has no effect on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. 
It also is slowly dropping in voltage until near zero, then green light re appears and board powers on. 

Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and the issue is unchanged.
